text: Only solid crystalline substances are considered minerals .
Orderly crystalline structure .
Minerals are chemical compounds having compositions that can be expressed by a chemical formula .
Minerals form by natural geologic processes .
Solid substance .
Minerals are crystalline substances , made up of atoms ( or ions ) that are arranged in an orderly , repetitive manner .
However , the compositions of some minerals vary within specific , well-defined limits .
Definite chemical composition that allows for some variation .
Inorganic crystalline solids , such as ordinary table salt ( halite ) , that are found naturally in the ground are considered minerals .
Sugar , a crystalline solid like salt but extracted from sugarcane or sugar beets , is a common example of such an organic compound . )
Ice ( frozen water ) fits this criterion and is considered a mineral , whereas liquid water and water vapor do not .
If these materials are buried and become part of the rock record , geologists consider them minerals .
This occurs because certain elements can substitute for others of similar size without changing the mineral ’s internal structure .
Some naturally occurring solids , such as volcanic glass ( obsidian ) , lack a repetitive atomic structure and are not considered 5 .
Synthetic materials , meaning those produced in a laboratory or by human intervention , are not considered minerals .
Many marine animals secrete inorganic compounds , such as calcium carbonate ( calcite ) , in the form of shells and coral reefs .
Generally inorganic .
The exception is mercury , which is found in its liquid form in nature .
This orderly packing of atoms is reflected in the regularly shaped objects called crystals .
This proportion of silicon to oxygen is true for any sample of pure quartz , regardless of its origin .
Naturally occurring .
